Reviews.Content: Dated Nice hotel (was formally the Ritz), but needs updating badly. This place just has a sense of old. Smells musty, rooms are outdated, etc... Rooftop pool is great and has nice views of harbor. Bondi Explorer bus stops directly out front which is great.
Reviews.Author: soderblom

Reviews.Content: Magnificent Views from the Top Floor We stayed for four nights. At the Club level (the top floor) all rooms had balcomies, and we had an intoxicating view of the Sydney Harbor. The room was reasonably large for a big city, with a spacious marble-tiled bathroom. The location was superb, with many restaurants within walking distance and the ferry to downtown no more than a 5-minute walk.
Reviews.Author: Alex_Tallinn

Reviews.Content: Now this is it..... Just as a 4 star place should be. Elegant fittings, good customer service. A clean room to boot! Treat yourself to a great rest, in a quality place. I usually get a good deal on [--]
Reviews.Author: WeTravellers

Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel Stayed 5 nights at the Stamford Plaza Double Bay recently. Fast, efficient, friendly check-in. Room was very spacious, nicely furnished. Bed was king size and very comfortable. Beautiful marble tiled bathroom with full bath and very spacious. In a great location, with several great restaurants and cafes close by. Short bus ride into the city. Housekeeping ignored requests for extra tea bags, and our friends also had their request for extra pillows ignored.Only downside was that it is very noisy, in that you can hear people talking loudly in the passage, and doors seemed to be slamming all night. The doors to the rooms do not have an efficient stopper on them, so you could hear every door all the way along the passage as it closed. For this reason I would probably not stay there again as it means you don't get a good night's sleep.
Reviews.Author: zeehan

Reviews.Content: Best I've Stayed In! Absolutely loved this elegant hotel with fantastic service. Had a huge, luxurious bathroom. Lots of nice touches in the room like a pillow menu that even had a pregnancy pillow available, robes, slippers, chocolates, etc. Found a great deal online that made this 5-star cheaper than many 3-stars right in the city, also included a wonderful breakfast each day. The bus and the 10-minute express ferry mean you are as close to the CBD and tourist sites as you would be if you stayed right in the city. Very helpful concierge and doormen. Prices for food in the neighborhood are too high--head to other areas to eat outside the hotel.
Reviews.Author: gretel623

Reviews.Content: Dated but still great! My husband and I stayed at the Stamford Plaza for my brother-in-law's wedding. We arrived early and couldn't check in. We were happy to go for a wander as Double Bay is a beautiful area of Sydney. However, the hotel said that they would call when room was ready, but they did not. We eventually got sick of waiting and went back and they checked us in, no apology for not calling us. Despite this little hiccup, our stay at the hotel was great. The rooms are very dated, they look like an old English hotel, so if you are looking for modern decor this hotel is not for you. The bathrooms are big with bath and the beds are king size which is nice. Room service was efficient with friendly staff and were willing to make things not on the menu. Buffet breakfast was really good also. Other than the check-in staff, found all other staff to most helpful.We needed to leave my husband's hire suit at reception to be collected and they were happy to do that also left shoes in the hotel and they were happy to post these to me. I got a great deal through the hotel's website, but would be happy to pay full price for the experience again.
Reviews.Author: Madgey

Reviews.Content: A touch of class I stayed here for 2 nights last weekend and I was impressed. I contacted the hotel directly and managed to get a great rate (approx $200 per night) and the woman I dealt with via email was very helpful. The only downside was when I rang to book over the phone they said I had to deal with the girl directly and could only book with her. The hotel is very opulant and has an old fashioned English feel. When you arrive by taxi you need to walk upstairs or take the lift up to the lobby. We had a lovely view of the park.The only downside of staying in double bay is you can't get a shuttle bus to the airport - it was approx $50 each way in a taxi which is not cheap.
Reviews.Author: CleaSan

Reviews.Content: Tired, lacklustre service. Watch the bill on the way out! We stayed at the Stamford under their Celebration Package, as we were having a much-needed weekend away together. The Celebration Package has High Tea and Breakfast included.Check-in was reasonably quick and friendly.We had the High Tea on the day of check-in. They have a number of levels of High Tea, for which the one included with the package was the middle of the road. The food was quite nice, and fresh. I'm just glad that we had it as part of our package, as at $31, it was incredibly expensive for what you get. Quite average. If you're looking for High Tea, go to the InterContinental instead.The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and we had a great nights sleep. Overall, the room was a bit dated and tired, but if you're a local, you go in there expecting it.We were shocked at the buffet breakfast. When we arrived, there was absolutely no-one there. A bit disconcerting for a 5-star hotel in Sydney!Overall, the stay wasn't unpleasant. However, the people service at the hotel was just lacklustre. There was no enthusiasm, no desire to make our stay enjoyable.Also, the breakfast was loaded onto the bill on checkout; which it shouldn't have been under our package. If I hadn't checked as carefully as I did; I would've paid $60 above what I was supposed to.
Reviews.Author: Avytar

Reviews.Content: nice hotel. wouldnt pay full price i booked just a one night stay at the stamford plaza double bay through a last minute travel agency website because i needed somewhere close to bondi beach without having to drive home.(perfect position for out of the city but close to town/ beach nightlife/ the cross etc) paid only $200 for a one night stay in a king delux room. arrived to a very nice young valet parking gentleman.the foyer and reception areas are lovely great art works and beautiful furniture with the staff being very accommodating at check in.(as i was late but not a problem unless after midnight where they require a phonecall). a credit card copy is required which is pretty average in sydney.(for security etc). 5 minutes later i was on my way up to our room. the upper class area attracts the higher paying market so it was nice and quiet with no party animals next door for the long weekend if you get my drift.i was on the 5th floor which gave a nice view over the outdoor gardens with french doors opening up for fresh air flow.the rooms are nice i was in the basic king hotel type room. clean carpets, beautiful marble bathroom, huge shower plus bath. clean but could have done with a once over thorough clean. double vanity with the little bits and pieces of soap shampoo etc.the main room was a little tired looking but comfortable. king bed could have done with some updated linen(looked like hospital sheets)(im a nurse lol) bed was very comfy. only had 3 pillows so called reception for a couple more and they arrived a quick 5 mins later which was good.furniture wasnt too bad nice antique style but could have done with a good cleaning. wasnt dirty just tired. TV they definately needed to invest in. was an old 80's looking 48cm stuck in the tv cupboard. again would expect more if you were paying full price. minibar as usual was terribly over priced, $4.50 aus for a marsbar. bring your own wine i advise! complimentary tea coffee etc. old kettle stuffed in the cupboard....didnt bother with that.big thick curtains for a good sleep in and order in brakfast if your willing to pay the price .aprox $32-35 per person for a standard breakky.id advise to go over the road to the cherryjams cafe (nightclub upstairs for the willing highly recommended) lovely food and nice coffee for less the price.nice little pool on the rooftop heated slightly for the mornings with a gorgeous view over double bay looking out to the city skyline. also tables and chairs for a nice lunch spot.perfect location if you're looking for somewhere close to the city and beaches aprox $12-15 aus taxi ride in traffic to bondi. ever so close to the famous oxford stip and kings cross night life. beautiful area with clean surroundings and quiet streets.all over a nice hotel with very friendly staff willing to help with all needs. shop around though... you dont and shouldnt need to pay full price for this '5*' hotel.id also highly recommend hurricanes bar and grill roscoe st bondi. the best bbq chicken or pork ribs you'll ever taste in your life! one for the family!
Reviews.Author: truthspoken

Reviews.Content: 5 star?? We initially travelled to Sydney and planned to stay in a budget hotel, as we chose to place particular emphasis on other aspects of our trip. After witnessing what budget meant, we promptly contacted the Stamford Plaza in Double Bay expecting a 5 Star experience.The Valet parking was quite welcoming however, the experience travelled well south from there. The reception staff were completely cold and resentful about their mere existence and this was reflected by their half hearted service. The rooms provided us with a garage sale musty odour which you would expect from visting an outer suburb pub/motel.The general building facilities are ageing and the interiors strive to give us the impressions of the charm of yesteryear, however, the only feeling one perceives is one of government housing, tatty wallpaperd, stained carpet accommodation. A serious concern was an indident where my wife and I were left waiting for a lift for 35 minutes as one lift was out of order. Upon contacting reception enquiring about stair access, we were advised that the lift was the only exit from the building and that our patience was appreciated. BEWARE the fire hazard in a building which consists of primary timber structure.My advice....do NOT stay there!
Reviews.Author: wassouf99

Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a great location If you want to stay in a quieter part of Sydney yet able to reach any of Sydney's enviable destinations in minutes then Double Bay is a good place to stay. In the Double Bay and surrounding area, the Stamford Plaza is definitely a great hotel. The hotel is just minutes walk to many buses and the local ferries to Rose Bay, Wstson's Bay and Circular Quay.All the staff we encountered were courteous, efficient and helpful. The young men at the door were very informative when information was requested of them and only to pleased to help in any situation reqired when asked.You can see that when the hotel was originally designed that a qualitative approach was applied. I will add that in 2007 it is perhaps a little jaded in the rooms themselves, but if you are not spending all day locked up in your room, you could do a lot worse. Still the accommodations were very comfortable and clean. My husband has the habit of leaving his valuables lying around and on this occasion did not disappoint. The ladies who maintained the rooms daily were trustworthy, almost invisible in going about their business.If you want modern and brand new, maybe you should look somewhere else. If you are looking for comfortable and aesthetically pleasing in a great quiet location, then the Stamford Plaza should suit.We did not have breakfast or room service and cannot comment on those services.
Reviews.Author: Blossom55

Reviews.Content: Great location, but in need of renovation I have stayed at this hotel every time I go to Sydney. This was the most dissapointing stay I have had. The rooms are tired and in need of renovation. The heating didn't work properly in the room.The restaurant Winstons had a stale and musty odour and the furniture was old and in need of replacement. The cushions on the sofas were flat, the coffee tables were stained and the crockery was cracked. I sent the cracked tea pot back and asked for another one and got charged for the additional pot of tea!The breakfast was nice, except for the broken, toaster they had sitting on the table with the dirty hand prints all over it.The outside of the hotel was dirty with lots of cigarette butts on the ground.Other than this, the staff were all friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable and the location was great.
Reviews.Author: jkcb

Reviews.Content: Nice Property Nice property - friendly, efficient and helpful staff - particularly the bell desk. Excellent area for cafe's. Close to the city.Beds a little tired as are the pillows. Also had some issues with poor heating in the rooms. Excellent bar called Winstons on site with helpful staff.Understand that the property is closing soon - will be a shame.
Reviews.Author: AJMFiji

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with easy access to City by Ferry This was the second time I have stayed at the Stamford Plaza. I must say that I would not hestitate staying there again. The area is nice and quite, although the locals call it Double Pay as the prices are a little inflated here. But its quite and you only have a 5 minute walk to a small beach and a ferry that takes you to Circular Quay. The hotel is clean and the staff very courteous and friendly. If I had any complaints it would be the breakfast, I only took the breakfast once but the cooked food was cold or lukewarm. So I decided to eat outside for the remaining 10 days of my stay. But even taking that into consideration I would recommend this hotel. Get a room with a sea view if you can.
Reviews.Author: Dan_Whicker

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Service ... needs updated Great location to spend some quiet time away from Sydney city, but close enought o be in the thick of the action within minutes. The premises itself needs some attention, expensive high quality fit out but now needs upgrading. The highlight is Scott Fini who pays the piano bar 4 nights a week. This man is one of the most talented entertainers in Australia - he makes this venue the only place to stay in sydney if you want something special.
Reviews.Author: australian73

Reviews.Content: Never again!! This was one of the worst stays i've ever had in a hotel. Welcome to the pool area enjoy a nice relaxing glass of wine along with the cockroaches, in fact invite them from your room to join you. Unless you enjoy talking for and hour before dinner arrives try one of the other overpriced restaurants in the area which can also serve up wet slop. I was temped to try the gym but valued my life and that of my partners to much. Well at least room service was o.k. (sorry i lie this also took 30 mins from ordering, so how long to make two cups of coffee?). If you had to stay here take a pack lunch and a sense of humour. Fawlty Towers watch out this may seriously be a contender as the worst hotel in Australia.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Grand entrance masks fading star ! Just returned from a 2 night romantic break at this Double bay hotel. I was excited at the prospect of a city escape and the web site promised a luxury hotel in the leafy suburb. Pulling into the drive the concierge were friendly and welcoming advising us the lobby and check in was on the first floor. With such a grand entrance we were expecting 5 star service all the way. The front desk staff were cold, with little eye contact and hardly a welcome for us new arrivals. We were processed and given directions to our room. The room itself was as described only tired and in need of refurbishment, stained carpets, peeling wallpaper and lacking some items described on the web site. We booked a harbour view and got one which was a pleasure. The bathroom was spacious but poorly lit with basic white towels, certainly not 5 star quality.Room service failed on 2 requests for a large pot of stong coffee, sending up regular / weak coffee despite my verbal request and confirmation of strong.The second day we were up and out out of our room before 10am to see the sights. We left the make up our room request on the door but were disapointed to return 3 times with the room still not made up. A phone call to housekeeping was met with a short sharp response of investigation. Eventually our room was made up by 3.30pm that afternoon, with various stock items not replenished. Check out was a repeat of the cold approach of staff, no enquiry was made wether we enjoyed our stay only Did you use anything from the mini bar ?.We were disapointed at the approach of some key staff who are the face of the hotel letting it down badly. The 5 star tag and prices charged do not reflect the service and standard of this hotel and we shall not use them again.
Reviews.Author: pendragon66

Reviews.Content: Good value upper-range hotel Just stayed a night here a couple of weeks ago. Our interconnecting rooms were perfectly decent (not at all shabby) with views of rooftops and the pool with plenty of trees around.We normally stay in the CBD, so enjoyed wandering around the boutiques in Double Bay. Great location if you don't mind the 10-15 minute trip into the city.You have to go upstairs to the main lobby, but this didn't really worry us. The breakfast was good and service generally was very efficient and friendly.This wouldn't be my choice for a first time in Sydney because of the lack of iconic views and distance from the tourist attractions, but for a relatively frequent visitor it is very pleasant. We'll be back.
Reviews.Author: OnThePoint

Reviews.Content: Exquisite, 5 star and inexpensive       Sydney beach
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Average       The room service was so delicious nad beautifully presented that we took a picture!
Reviews.Author: Yellabrick

Reviews.Content: Bella Sydney   showReview(6694231, 'full');
Reviews.Author: bubuZaragoza
